<Text: The Marsileaceae
1:
--------------------
Text: Marsileaceae:  The group is commonly known as the "pepperwort family" or as the "water-clover family" because the leaves of the genus "Marsilea" superficially resemble the leaves of a four-leaf clover (a flowering plant).
Triplets:<Marsileaceae
2:
--------------------
<Text: Marsileaceae:  Leaves of this fern have sometimes been used to substitute for clover leaves on Saint Patrick's Day.>
Triplets:<Marsileaceae
3:
--------------------
Text: Marsileaceae:  In all, the family contains 3 genera and 50 to 80 species with most of those belonging to "Marsilea".
Triplets:<Marsileaceae
